pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.5: 51. The training rule on entering monasteries
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.2: a number of monks who were dressed in only one robe were making robes in a village monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.3: Nuns entered the monastery without asking permission and approached those monks.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.4: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.5: “How can nuns enter a monastery without asking permission?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.6: “Is it true, monks, nuns did that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.9: “… How can nuns enter a monastery without asking permission?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.10: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.11: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.12: ‘If a nun enters a monastery without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.13: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.1: Soon afterwards those monks left that monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.2: Even though the nuns knew that the monks had left, they did not go there.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.4: When the nuns knew that this was the case, they asked permission and then entered that monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.5: They approached the monks and bowed down to them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.6: The monks then said to them, “Sisters, why didn’t you sweep the monastery, or put out water for drinking or water for washing?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.7: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule that we may not enter a monastery without asking permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.8: That’s why we didn’t do it.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.9: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha assembled and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.10: “Monks, when a monk is available, a nun should enter a monastery only after asking permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.11: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.12: ‘If a nun, when a monk is available, enters a monastery without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.13: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.1: Soon afterwards those monks left that monastery once more, and then returned once again.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.2: Thinking that the monks were still away, the nuns entered the monastery without asking permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.4: “We have entered a monastery without asking permission, even though a monk was available. But the Buddha has laid down a training rule against this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.5: Could it be that we have committed an offense entailing confession?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.7: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.8: “And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.9: ‘If a nun, knowing that there are monks in a monastery, enters it without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.6: she knows it by herself or others have told her or they have told her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.7: There are monks in a monastery:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.8: even where monks stay at the foot of a tree.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.10: if she goes beyond the boundary of an enclosed monastery without asking permission of a monk or a novice monk or a monastery worker, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.11: If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed monastery, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.1: If there are monks in a monastery, and she perceives that this is so, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.2: If there are monks in a monastery, but she is unsure if this is so, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.3: If there are monks in a monastery, but she does not perceive that this is so, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.4: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she perceives that there are, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.5: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.6: If there are no monks in a monastery, and she perceives that there are not, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.2: if she enters after asking permission of an available monk;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.3: if, when there is no available monk, she enters without asking permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.4: if she goes while looking at the head of a nun in front of her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.5: if she is going to where the nuns have assembled;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.6: if a path goes through the monastery;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.10: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.11: The first training rule is finished.
